metadata.title: YouTube Shorts Monetization 2025: How to Earn From Short Videos
metadata.description: Complete guide to monetizing YouTube Shorts. Revenue sharing, requirements, and how much Shorts creators earn.

hero.headline: YouTube Shorts Monetization: How to Earn in 2025
hero.subheadline: Understanding the Shorts revenue model and how to maximize your short-form earnings.

sections.content: YouTube Shorts monetization works differently than long-form content. Revenue comes from a shared ad pool rather than per-video ads. Understanding this system helps you set realistic expectations and optimize for Shorts income.

content.title: Revenue Pool
content.description: Ads run between Shorts in feed. Revenue pooled and distributed based on views and music usage.

content.title: Music Impact
content.description: Using licensed music splits your share with rights holders. Original audio keeps full creator portion.

content.title: View-Based Split
content.description: Your share of the pool depends on your percentage of total Shorts views.

sections.title: Shorts Monetization Requirements
content: 10 million Shorts views in 90 days, OR
Accept Shorts monetization module in YPP

sections.title: Maximizing Shorts Revenue
content: Post consistently to build view volume
Focus on views, not just engagement

sections.title: Shorts Earnings Reality Check
content: Volume is key to meaningful revenue
Shorts are better for audience building than direct revenue
Long-form remains the primary revenue driver
Shorts can unlock YPP for long-form monetization

faq.question: How much do YouTube Shorts pay?
faq.answer: RPM typically ranges from $0.02-0.10 per 1000 views. Much lower than long-form. 1 million views might earn $20-100, varying by factors.

faq.question: Is the Shorts Fund still active?
faq.answer: The original Shorts Fund was replaced by revenue sharing in February 2023. Shorts now earn from the ad revenue pool system.

faq.question: Does using trending sounds hurt revenue?
faq.answer: Yes. Licensed music splits your share with rights holders. For maximum revenue, use original audio or royalty-free music.

faq.question: Are Shorts worth it for money?
faq.answer: For direct revenue, usually no. For building audience that watches long-form content, absolutely. Think of Shorts as discovery, not income.
